Cathedral_City.McCallum Theatre:
The McCallum Theatre is a 1,127-seat theatre and concert venue located on the southern edge of the campus of College of the Desert in Palm Desert, California, USA.
Named after a pioneering Coachella Valley family, the facility's opening in January 1988 aired as a special on NBC, the culmination of ten years and US$22M of development.


== History ==
Talk of the facility began in 1974 with the formation of an informal group calling itself "Friends of the Cultural Center." Fundraising began in earnest with thirteen sold-out performances by Fred Waring. By 1984, local developer Terry Hahn contributed US$1M to the project and Gerald Ford became part of the board of directors.
